intro: Diosma parvula, commonly known as the small diosma, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in desert or arid environments. It has slender, branched stems and small, pinnately divided leaves. Diosma parvula is an herbaceous perennial that blooms in the spring and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
